image.altText: Tasmania Police officers at crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man who was shot twice in the chest by Tasmania Police after allegedly threatening people with a knife has died in hospital.

title.children: Man shot twice in chest by police dies, officer wounded during confrontation

image.altText: Mountain and houses

props.synopsis: Homes Tasmania was established in 2022 to deliver housing, and homelessness and crisis accommodation. Just two years later, an interstate auditor will conduct a review to determine if the new entity is meeting its targets.

title.children: Tasmania's housing body under review two years into plan to deliver 10,000 affordable homes

image.altText: A colonial-looking lounge room with leather couches, a fire place and red carpet

props.synopsis: The 163-year-old Tasmanian Club has, after much fuss, voted to overturn a rule excluding women from the bar â€” but before you ladies begin queuing up for a peek inside, please note â€” you'll still need to be accompanied by a gentleman.

title.children: Women now permitted in the bar at the Tasmanian Club â€” but they have to be with a man

image.altText: A large red and white passenger ferry in a body of water against a wintery backdrop

props.synopsis: The Spirit of Tasmania IV ferry is making its way across the North Sea to its temporary home in Scotland, but taxpayers are yet to learn how much it will cost to remain there.

title.children: As the newest Spirit of Tasmania ferry heads to its temporary home in Scotland, berthing costs remain unknown

image.altText: A woman with long black hair and a green hoodie embraces her laughing daughter.

props.synopsis: Young mothers in Tasmania report stigma as being the hardest battle they've faced, saying the way they have been treated simply for being young and pregnant is "not OK".

title.children: 'The way that I was treated': Teen mums talk about the biggest issue they faced â€” society

image.altText: A sign with LGH and emergency written on it.

props.synopsis: Survivors of alleged historical child sexual abuse at a Tasmanian hospital have received a combined $7.85 million settlement, with one claimant saying that while no money could remedy the abuse, it was "life-changing".

title.children: Survivors of paedophiles working at Tasmanian hospital receive $7.85 million compensation

image.altText: The exterior of an old wooden hut surrounded by bush.

props.synopsis: Halls Hut is about as isolated as you can get in Australia's wilderness. A heli-tourism proponent will seek federal approval to fix it up, but is facing extensive opposition from bushwalkers, fly-fishers and environmental groups over the use of a helicopter.

title.children: It's a hut, on an island, in a lake, in the wilderness. Its upkeep has now become a political issue

image.altText: A woman sitting against a kitchen counter at home.

props.synopsis: Mum of two Jane Dutton has made the call to shut down her kids' social media before the ban comes into effect from the end of next year. Like many parents, she felt pressure to allow her children onto the platforms in the first place.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Mum who let kids onto social media so they would 'fit in' starts under-16s ban straight away

image.altText: A man intertwining his fingers while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: French Prime Minister Michel Barnier is bracing for a no-confidence vote this week, a political reckoning almost certain to topple his fragile government and send shock waves across the eurozone.

title.children: French government faces collapse as left and far-right submit no-confidence motions

image.altText: Sexting

props.synopsis: A brand new register designed to crackdown on SMS scams has been announced by the government.Â

title.children: Telcos required to block scam texts under government crackdown â€” as it happened

image.altText: Achieving their dream of home ownership through hard work and dedication

props.synopsis: Meatworkers Jordan Cullinane, 23, and Remi Krahenbring, 25, knew they didn't want to be paying off someone else's mortgage, so they put their heads down and started saving.

title.children: 'We saved for this': Young couple crack housing dream

image.altText: An elderly man with a grumpy expression pictured with a microphone in front of him

props.synopsis: The United Nations chief expresses concern over a recent escalation in Syria's civil war, which had remained dormant until a recent surprise rebel offensive in Aleppo.

title.children: UN chief 'alarmed' by resurgence of fighting in Syrian civil war as hundreds killed since Aleppo offensive

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The royal commission uncovered "extensive" evidence of sexual assaults within Defence.

title.children: 'Ridiculously overdue': Advocates respond to promise to act on sexual violence in ADF

image.altText: IMAGE Elton John performs on stage

props.synopsis: The Devil Wears Prada Musical has premiered in London's West End but its composer, Sir Elton John, was unable to watch the performance after losing his vision. Â

title.children: Elton John reveals he is unable to watch his own musical after losing vision

image.altText: A young woman takes a selfie from her hospital bed

props.synopsis: Despite a cost-of-living crisis, young people aged 25 to 29 have had the biggest take-up of private health insurance over the last year.

title.children: Young people taking up private health insurance in high numbers, reversing 'death spiral' trend

image.altText: Signs in front of a marquee at an anti-fire ant baiting event.

props.synopsis: Australia's fire ant authority says "downright dangerous" misinformation spread on traditional and social media is hampering its efforts to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Australia is fighting a fire ant invasion, but authorities say they are also locked in a misinformation war

image.altText: A red sign on the door warning of child abuse material.

props.synopsis: 7.30 has been given a rare glimpse inside the AFP's Child Protection Triage Unit, where investigators often confront the worst examples of child exploitation.Â

title.children: 'Not everyone can do it': Behind this door, AFP officers are exposed to the worst of humanity

image.altText: Close-up of the cocaine bricks.

props.synopsis: From an unassuming boat moored in the Hervey Bay boat harbour, police were unloading 2.34 tonnes of cocaine â€” Australia's largest cocaine seizure. But why Hervey Bay?

title.children: A Queensland coastal town becomes the scene of Australia's largest-ever cocaine bust

image.altText: Neale Fraser at Wimbledon in 1962

props.synopsis: Australian tennis great Neale Fraser, a winner of 19 major titles, has died aged 91.

title.children: Australian 19-time tennis major winner Neale Fraser dies aged 91

image.altText: A person's hand holding a mobile phone, showing the Spotify logo.

props.synopsis: Australian music lovers are patiently waiting to see what their year in listening looked like as Spotify teases the release of its 2024 wrap.Â

title.children: When is Spotify Wrapped 2024 coming out and how can I see it?

image.altText: A large satellite dish points towards the sky.

props.synopsis: Carnarvon's enormous satellite dish is a step closer to being back in action amid a global space and technology boom.Â

title.children: NASA dish in remote WA receives first signal in almost four decades

image.altText: A graphic of a speed limit for a 90kph zone.

props.synopsis: Driving in later life can bring its own challenges, and while rules around older road users vary widely across the country, options for navigating those challenges include licence assessments and conversations around so-called "driving retirement".Â

title.children: What are the rules for older Australian drivers?

image.altText: A barista holding a silver milk jug  and a white cup full of coffee, pouring the milk into the coffee to make latte art

props.synopsis: A Business Council ranking of states and territories has crowned South Australia the best place in the country to run a business and labelled Victoria the worst. It could spur a debate inside Labor about whether the state is beginning to hurt Anthony Albanese's election chances.

title.children: Victoria named worst state to open new cafe as Labor debates brand damage in Albanese stronghold

image.altText: A composite image of a man in a suit and a woman wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The federal government is attempting to spruik its economic management just as the Reserve Bank is digging its heels in over inflation. With an election months away, it doesn't bode well for Labor.

title.children: The RBA is holding firm on future interest rate cuts. It doesn't bode well ahead of an election

image.altText: A man in a light blue singlet sitting in front of plants.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis, who is wanted over Melbourne's 1977 Easey Street murders, is expected to arrive back in the city on Tuesday evening, after being extradited from Italy.

title.children: Suspect in Victoria's 1977 Easey Street murders extradited from Italy

props.synopsis: The Australian facial injectables industry was estimated to be worth $4.1 billion in 2023, with big corporates including Wesfarmers owning a slice of the market. But the business model behind the boom has attracted complaints and raised some safety concerns.

title.children: From Bunnings to botox: The surprisingly big business of cosmetic injectables

image.altText: A man holds two drumsticks in a recording studio with a sign ABC Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: Underneath Jarred Bird's smile, he's pedalling hard to navigate working life with severe dyslexia.

title.children: It took Jarred 18 years to find out he had severe dyslexia. The diagnosis was the 'last piece of the puzzle'

image.altText: A man in a crowd waving a black, white and green flag in front of an ancient fort with damaged buildings in the background

props.synopsis: The decapitation and capitulation of Hezbollah in Lebanon after an Israeli onslaught has rippled across the border to the protracted Syrian civil war, reigniting an even more complex and devastating conflict.

title.children: With Putin busy in Ukraine, and Hezbollah tied up with Israel, someone forgot to check in on Syria

image.altText: People hold Taiwanese flags during a parade

props.synopsis: The head of federal parliament's intelligence committee has suggested Australia is bolstering its military capabilities in part to deter China from invading Taiwan.

title.children: Australian senator says China went 'berserk' over Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan

image.altText: Two men embrace in an office.

props.synopsis: Before leaving the White House in January, President Joe Biden will provide Ukraine with military aid to bolster the government in Kyiv in its war with Russia.

title.children: US to send Stinger missiles and landmines to Ukraine in $1.1 billion weapons package for Kyiv's war with Russia

image.altText: People running out onto a street.

props.synopsis: The stampede broke out on Sunday afternoon at the stadium in the city of Nzerekore during the final of a local tournament.

title.children: More than 50 people killed in stampede following clashes at a Guinea soccer match

image.altText: Image of Venus's clouds taken by the Akatsuki spacecraft.

props.synopsis: Venus was once covered in water. Or was it? An analysis of our twin planetâ€™s atmosphere suggests it could never have supported life.

title.children: Scientists thought Venus was once like Earth. A new study suggests it never had water

image.altText: An elderly couple standing in a field with smoke from a power station in the background

props.synopsis: Jim Radford lived up the road from Fukushima's nuclear power plant before it failed. He has strong feelings about plans for another one near his Gippsland home.

title.children: Latrobe Valley residents weigh up a potential nuclear future to their coal-powered past

image.altText: A close up of a koala eating leaves.

props.synopsis: Researchers from the University of Sydney undertook the task in the wake of the Black Summer bushfires, when they found there was a lack of data to be able to quantify the loss to the koala population.

title.children: The '3 billion-piece puzzle' researchers hope will help save koalas from extinction

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman with short grey hair and a navy top, standing with her arms crossed, a green monstera in the foreground

props.synopsis:
The acclaimed author of Monkey Grip and The Children's Bach is back: this time she turns her razor-sharp writer's eye to her 16-year-old grandson's footy team.

Â

title.children: At 82, literary legend Helen Garner just proved she can't be pigeon-holed
